content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to deliver health services through Department facilities or other entities. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to deliver health services through Department facilities or other entities. These plans must adhere to standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, including minimum health care benefits such as those covered under parts A and B of the Medicare program. The Secretary may also establish an enrollment system for veterans to enroll in the plan. Cost-sharing requirements may be established for veterans enrolled in the plan to cover the costs of providing benefits. The Secretary may establish cost-sharing requirements for veterans enrolled in a plan under Chapter 17 of title 38, to cover costs not paid by Medicare. This may include an enrollment premium, copayment charges, and deductibles. The Secretary may establish cost-sharing requirements for veterans enrolled in a plan under Chapter 17 of title 38 to cover costs not paid by Medicare, including an enrollment premium, copayment charges, and deductibles. Payments received for care provided to veterans enrolled in the plan shall be credited to the Department's medical appropriation for furnishing care and services. The Secretary cannot operate a plan at a Department facility without the director's approval. The Secretary may not operate a plan under subsection (a) at a Department facility unless sufficient medical care funds have been allotted to that facility for the fiscal year to provide hospital care and medical services to veterans. The facility must have allocated enough medical care funds for the fiscal year to provide hospital care and medical services to veterans in need. Establishment of managed health-care plans. Requirement for payment for certain services provided by department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans on behalf of certain veterans who are Medicare-eligible individuals. The Department manages health care plans for Medicare-eligible veterans under similar terms as payments under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Managed health care plans organized under section 1705 provide care to these veterans with certification in effect. The Department manages health care plans for Medicare-eligible veterans under section 1705, providing care with certification in effect, deemed as certified Medicare Choice organizations under the Social Security Act. The Secretary certifies Department managed health care plans for Medicare-eligible veterans under section 1705, conforming to standards prescribed under the Social Security Act. The term 'Medicare program' refers to the health insurance program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, and 'Medicare-eligible veteran' refers to a veteran entitled to benefits under the Medicare program. The text discusses the certification of Department managed health care plans for Medicare-eligible veterans under section 1705, in accordance with the standards of the Social Security Act. It defines terms such as 'Medicare program' as the health insurance program under title XVIII of the Social Security Act, 'Medicare-eligible veteran' as a veteran entitled to benefits under the Medicare program, and 'Medicare Choice organization' as a managed health care organization under part C of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Medicare payment for certain veterans under Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code, applies to care provided after the enactment of this Act.
